results.title: Siberia: The Land and its people
results.brief_description: Introduces Siberia and indicates the huge area it embraces. Traces the history of its growth and gives examples of the great variety of its inhabitants. Also shows the remnants of pre-revolution religion. Fom the series “Siberia: The Endless horizon”.
results.description: Introduces Siberia and indicates the huge area it embraces. Traces the history of its growth and gives examples of the great variety of its inhabitants. Also shows the remnants of pre-revolution religion. Fom the series “Siberia: The Endless horizon”.

results.title: Siberia: the endless horizon
results.brief_description: Deals with the nomadic people of Northern Siberia and explains their dependence on the reindeer. Traces the history of these people and the steps that have been taken to integrate them into Russian life. Edited from the documentary “Siberia: the endless horizon”. Part 3: survival in a cold climate.

results.title: Sibelius
results.brief_description: Jean Julius Christian Sibelius, one of the greatest living composers, is known to music lovers throughout the world. In this film, excerpts from the Sibelius Violin Concerto, and from his Impromptu, are played, as well as a short extract from the ballet “Scaramouche”, danced by the Helsinki opera ballet.

results.title: Shrivastava and Munni (India )
results.creator_credit: Japan Broadcasting Corporation and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description: With a population of 570 million people India ranks second only to the Republic of China in population; so the work of Munni, a social worker, and Shrivastava, a community leader, takes on new urgency and meaning. The two women journey to out-of-the-way villages to convince largely illiterate village women to use birth control mehtods.

results.title: Shringar: hair styles of India
results.creator_credit: Ravi Prakash, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Indian women’s hair styles; their origin in tradition; how the hair is dressed and how the styles may be adapted to wear with Western dress. A stylist makes sketches for hair styles based on those seen in temple carvings and the Ajunta cave frescoes; how the hair is oiled and the styles built up; the use of garlands, particularly jasmine, and jkewellery; dressing a Western woman’s hair in adaptations of Indian styles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ravi Prakash, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Showtime [b&w]
results.creator_credit: Anne Bourke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A film of the Royal Melbourne show as seen through the eyes of a family group. Grandfather, a retired farmer, takes his daughter and her two teenage children to the show. To people like breeders of livestock, farmers and agricultural equipment salesmen, the show is an important yearly event, but for the family there is something to interest each member. Cooking demonstrations, displays of horsermanship, and the extensive pavilions showing domestic pets as well as farm animals all have their appeal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Bourke and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: Shows promise - should go far (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Michael Deakin and Yorkshire Harlech Television
results.brief_description: A study of four exceptional children in one family. Each child excels in at least one area of learning, eg., mathematics, music, painting. The film looks at the children’s upbringing and its influence on their development. Their mother explains her situation and philosophy underlying her upbringing of the children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Tuchner, Michael Deakin and Yorkshire Harlech Television

results.title: Shown by request
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Story of 16 mm film use and distribution in Great Britain. Films being used in village hall, in the country, during a factory lunch hour; how the film library works, the procedures in handling a new film and the method of handling requests through all steps until the film has been returned, repaired and put back in the vault.

results.title: Shotput
results.brief_description: Basic techniques have changed over time in relation to shotput. Action shots broken down into steps show correct use of body tension to maximise throws. Good quality instruction film.
